content.description: use some bad holds to get established on the slab, then tip toe up little knobs to the good topout. will eventually clean up to a 3 star line with some traffic and consistent cleaning.
content.location: obvious mossy turtle shaped boulder at bottom of incline.

content.description: sit start on some sloper crimps and bad feet. move right to some more sloper crimps, set up and make a big move right to a decent hold and get on top.
content.location: back side of front area's little boulder.

content.description: left arête only. start from the obvious hold near the bottom, make a reach to some holds at the base of the arête, then press your way up using only the left arête for hands. not too contrived, though you can bail out by making an awkward reach to the right arête and make it easier.
content.location: front boulder, south facing side, second problem from the right.

content.description: very beautiful arête. do it when it's cold! Stand start.
content.location: most obvious problem in the front area. beautifully tall arete

content.description: fun dyno for the grade. sit start on the left side of the boulder on two large, opposing, and sloping iron bands. get low and throw big for the horn shaped jug and top out.
content.location: boulder facing the trail to the rest of the front area. to the left of Andrew's problem

content.description: start with an obvious knob feature in the middle of the wall, make a left hand move to a sloper and make moves aiming at a horn-shaped jug up and to the left.  top out is slopey but will clean up.
content.location: coming from the south, this boulder is facing the trail down to the rest of the front area. hard to miss.

content.description: right side of the south facing face.  make one move to gain the holds at the bottom of the two arêtes, then use both arêtes to top out.
content.location: front area small boulder, pick up sticks side. right side of boulder when looking at face.

content.description:
start with a small right hand sidepull and a good left hand side pull. work your way up to a big shelf, then bust a fat awkward dyno to gain the sloper up top.   

  also, made this name up. definitely done before me.
content.location: on the corner of the small boulder on the south facing face. closest problem to pick up sticks.

content.description: First area you come across when taking the Hurricane Proper trail.
